book.title: The Sacred Clown's Modern West Trilogy
book.author: Richard A. Voorhees
book.subtitle: A satirical, myth-infused reimagining of the Western
book.description: A genre-blurring trilogy that fuses Indigenous myth, political satire, and frontier landscapes. From the Dakota plains to the Amazon rainforest, gods and mortals collide in a biting, irreverent narrative that skewers colonial legacies, ecological exploitation, and bureaucratic absurdity. Both sharp-witted and deeply resonant, it offers readers a story that is as entertaining as it is unsettling.

analysisOverview.title: Analysis Overview
analysisOverview.readership: The readership is urban, globally distributed, and highly educated, with strong representation among academics, activists, and cultural commentators. These readers favour trade paperbacks, audiobooks, and ebooks, often discover titles via critical reviews, podcasts, and indie bookstores, and gravitate toward fiction that combines sharp humour with cultural critique. Secondary readers come from eco-fiction, Western, and speculative circles, expanding the trilogy's crossover reach.
analysisOverview.classification: The trilogy is positioned at the crossroads of literary Western, Indigenous fiction, satire, and eco-fiction. Using a bespoke taxonomy of subgenres, it lands squarely in the emerging space of Indigenous and eco-Westerns with satirical resonance, offering a rare blend of mythic imagination, frontier iconography, and political sharpness.
analysisOverview.personas: Two key personas capture the readership: Daniel the Cultural Critic and Sofia the Ecological Story-Seeker. Daniel represents the intellectual reader seeking satire and cultural critique, while Sofia embodies the eco-conscious, globally minded reader drawn to myth and environmental themes. Daniel‚Äôs profile is especially central, reflecting the book‚Äôs strongest alignment with politically engaged, literary audiences.
analysisOverview.marketingGuidance: The marketing insights highlight opportunities to position the trilogy as both provocative and accessible, weaving together satire, myth, and cultural commentary. Copy and creative hooks can focus on irreverence, frontier myth, and ecological urgency. This early-stage guidance will help shape launch campaigns and provide the foundation for a fuller standalone marketing product in future iterations.

marketing.description: Marketing tab - Campaign strategy and promotional content
marketing.title: Stage 1 Marketing Plan
marketing.subtitle: Comprehensive campaign blueprint for launch
marketing.objective: Drive awareness, engagement, and sales for a globally relevant, genre-blurring satirical trilogy.
marketing.keyInsight: Audiences are drawn to satirical, mythic, and politically charged fiction that challenges convention while offering memorable storytelling. Positioning the trilogy as both entertaining and culturally resonant will unlock cross-genre appeal.
howToUse: Leverage this plan as a blueprint for all launch and growth activities.
Adapt messaging and channels based on performance feedback.
Coordinate content across digital and traditional platforms for consistency.
primaryKPIs: CTR and conversion on digital ads

funnels.name: Awareness
funnels.description: Introduce the trilogy‚Äôs satirical and mythic qualities to wide audiences.
funnels.formats: Short-form video ads, social teaser posts, influencer mentions
funnels.optimisation: A/B test creative angles (satire vs. mythic) and monitor engagement.

funnels.name: Consideration
funnels.description: Deepen engagement with excerpts, reviews, and author commentary.
funnels.formats: Email newsletters, podcast interviews, medium-length trailers
funnels.optimisation: Track open rates and click-throughs, adjust narrative hooks.

funnels.name: Conversion
funnels.formats: Retailer ads, direct-response social ads, launch events
funnels.optimisation: Focus spend on highest-performing demographics and regions.
